posts.content:
**CISA** Adds 3 to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV Catalog) based on
evidence of active exploitation:

  * [CVE-2023-36584](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-36584) Microsoft Windows Mark of the Web (MOTW) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (CVSS: 5.4 medium severity)
  * [CVE-2023-1671](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-1671) Sophos Web Appliance Command Injection Vulnerability ( **9.8 critical** )
  * [CVE-2023-2551](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-2551) Oracle Fusion Middleware Unspecified Vulnerability (8.8 high)

 **Link:** [https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2023/11/16/cisa-adds-
three-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog](https://www.cisa.gov/news-

posts.content:
**Unit 42** provides an in-depth analysis of the exploit chain used by pro-
Russian APT RomCom Group (tracked by Microsoft as Storm-0978) in a July 2023
campaign targeting groups supporting Ukraine's admission into NATO. RomCom
used a highly complex and well-developed exploit chain leveraging a remote
code execution (RCE) vulnerability in Microsoft Office designated
CVE-2023-36884 to infect its targets with malware. Unit 42's investigation
revealed a new exploit method related to it, which was assigned
CVE-2023-36584. They provide a technical analysis of the exploit chain and of
the new vulnerability. IOC provided.  
 **Link:** [https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/new-cve-2023-36584-discovered-
in-attack-chain-used-by-russian-apt/](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/new-
cve-2023-36584-discovered-in-attack-chain-used-by-russian-apt/)

posts.content:
Happy Patch Tuesday to those who celebrate: Microsoft, 59 vulnerabilities, 5
zero-days:

  * [CVE-2023-36025](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2023-36025) Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (8.8 high)
  * [CVE-2023-36033](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2023-36033) Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (7.8 high, publicly disclosed too)
  * [CVE-2023-36036](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2023-36036) Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (7.8 high)
  * publicly disclosed: [CVE-2023-36413](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2023-36413) Microsoft Office Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (6.5 medium)
  * publicly disclosed: [CVE-2023-36038](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2023-36038) ASP.NET Core Denial of Service Vulnerability (8.2 high)

Exploited Vulnerabilities Teams for quickly adding Microsoft's exploited zero-

within 2 hours of disclosure.

posts.content:
🚨 New Reptar CPU flaw impacts Intel desktop and server systems  
➥ [@BleepingComputer](https://infosec.exchange/@BleepingComputer)

posts.content:
Intel on Tuesday pushed microcode updates to fix a high-severity CPU bug that
has the potential to be maliciously exploited against cloud-based hosts.

The flaw, affecting virtually all modern Intel CPUs, causes them to “enter a
glitch state where the normal rules don’t apply,” Tavis Ormandy, one of
several security researchers inside Google who discovered the bug, reported.
Once triggered, the glitch state results in unexpected and potentially serious
behavior, most notably system crashes that occur even when untrusted code is
executed within a guest account of a virtual machine, which, under most cloud
security models, is assumed to be safe from such faults. Escalation of
privileges is also a possibility.

The bug, tracked under the common name Reptar and the designation
CVE-2023-23583, is related to how affected CPUs manage prefixes, which change
the behavior of instructions sent by running software. Intel x64 decoding
generally allows redundant prefixes—meaning those that don’t make sense in a
given context—to be ignored without consequence. During testing in August,
Ormandy noticed that the REX prefix was generating “unexpected results” when
running on Intel CPUs that support a newer feature known as fast short repeat
move, which was introduced in the Ice Lake architecture to fix microcoding
bottlenecks.

[https://arstechnica.com/security/2023/11/intel-fixes-high-severity-cpu-bug-
that-causes-very-strange-
behavior/](https://arstechnica.com/security/2023/11/intel-fixes-high-severity-
cpu-bug-that-causes-very-strange-behavior/)

CVE-2023-23583.description: Sequence of processor instructions leads to unexpected behavior for some Intel(R) Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege and/or information disclosure and/or denial of service via local access.

posts.content:
**AMD** security advisory: CVE-2023-20592 (medium severity, NVD score
pending, software-based fault injection attack) has a designer name
“CacheWarp”. Improper or unexpected behavior of the INVD instruction in some
AMD CPUs may allow an attacker with a malicious hypervisor to affect cache
line write-back behavior of the CPU leading to a potential loss of guest
virtual machine (VM) memory integrity.  
 **Link:** [https://www.amd.com/en/resources/product-security/bulletin/amd-
sb-3005.html](https://www.amd.com/en/resources/product-security/bulletin/amd-
sb-3005.html) See related [Bleeping Computer
reporting](https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/new-cachewarp-amd-
cpu-attack-lets-hackers-gain-root-in-linux-vms/).

vulnerability

CVE-2023-3899.description: A vulnerability was found in subscription-manager that allows local privilege escalation due to inadequate authorization. The D-Bus interface com.redhat.RHSM1 exposes a significant number of methods to all users that could change the state of the registration. By using the com.redhat.RHSM1.Config.SetAll() method, a low-privileged local user could tamper with the state of the registration, by unregistering the system or by changing the current entitlements. This flaw allows an attacker to set arbitrary configuration directives for /etc/rhsm/rhsm.conf, which can be abused to cause a local privilege escalation to an unconfined root.

posts.content:
**Microsoft** Security Response Center (MSRC) published 4 security
advisories:

  * [CVE-2023-36026](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2023-36026) (CVSSv3:4.3 medium severity) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability. In the FAQ section, it states that "The user would have to click on a specially crafted URL to be compromised by the attacker. The attacker is able to bypass the warning on the permissions message when visiting a potentially malicious website. (Loss of Integrity:Low)"
  * [CVE-2023-36008](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2023-36008) (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. In the FAQ section, it states that "The performance can be interrupted and/or reduced, but the attacker cannot fully deny service (Loss of Availability:Low). The attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could have limited ability to perform code execution (Loss of Integrity:Low)."
  * [CVE-2023-5997](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2023-5997) Chromium: CVE-2023-5997 Use after free in Garbage Collection. It does not contain more information than included in Google Chrome's [security advisory](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/11/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_14.html).
  * [CVE-2023-6112](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2023-6112) Chromium: CVE-2023-6112 Use after free in Navigation. Same as CVE-2023-5997 above this.

CVE-2023-36026 and CVE-2023-36008 are marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not
Exploited and Exploitation Less Likely. In Google Chrome's [security
advisory](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/11/stable-channel-update-
for-desktop_14.html) for CVE-2023-5997 and CVE-2023-6112, there was no mention
of exploitation.

Exploited and Exploitation Less Likely. In Google Chrome's [security
advisory](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/11/stable-channel-update-
for-desktop_14.html) for CVE-2023-5997 and CVE-2023-6112, there was no mention
of exploitation.

CVE-2022-29257.description: Electron is a framework for writing cross-platform desktop applications using JavaScript (JS), HTML, and CSS. A vulnerability in versions prior to 18.0.0-beta.6, 17.2.0, 16.2.6, and 15.5.5 allows attackers who have control over a given apps update server / update storage to serve maliciously crafted update packages that pass the code signing validation check but contain malicious code in some components. This kind of attack would require significant privileges in a potential victim's own auto updating infrastructure and the ease of that attack entirely depends on the potential victim's infrastructure security. Electron versions 18.0.0-beta.6, 17.2.0, 16.2.6, and 15.5.5 contain a fix for this issue. There are no known workarounds.

CVE-2022-29247.description: Electron is a framework for writing cross-platform desktop applications using JavaScript (JS), HTML, and CSS. A vulnerability in versions prior to 18.0.0-beta.6, 17.2.0, 16.2.6, and 15.5.5 allows a renderer with JS execution to obtain access to a new renderer process with `nodeIntegrationInSubFrames` enabled which in turn allows effective access to `ipcRenderer`. The `nodeIntegrationInSubFrames` option does not implicitly grant Node.js access. Rather, it depends on the existing sandbox setting. If an application is sandboxed, then `nodeIntegrationInSubFrames` just gives access to the sandboxed renderer APIs, which include `ipcRenderer`. If the application then additionally exposes IPC messages without IPC `senderFrame` validation that perform privileged actions or return confidential data this access to `ipcRenderer` can in turn compromise your application / user even with the sandbox enabled. Electron versions 18.0.0-beta.6, 17.2.0, 16.2.6, and 15.5.5 contain a fix for this issue. As a workaround, ensure that all IPC message handlers appropriately validate `senderFrame`.

CVE-2022-21718.description: Electron is a framework for writing cross-platform desktop applications using JavaScript, HTML and CSS. A vulnerability in versions prior to `17.0.0-alpha.6`, `16.0.6`, `15.3.5`, `14.2.4`, and `13.6.6` allows renderers to obtain access to a bluetooth device via the web bluetooth API if the app has not configured a custom `select-bluetooth-device` event handler. This has been patched and Electron versions `17.0.0-alpha.6`, `16.0.6`, `15.3.5`, `14.2.4`, and `13.6.6` contain the fix. Code from the GitHub Security Advisory can be added to the app to work around the issue.

zero-days:

  * [CVE-2023-36025](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2023-36025) Windows SmartScreen Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (8.8 high)
  * [CVE-2023-36033](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2023-36033) Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (7.8 high, publicly disclosed too)
  * [CVE-2023-36036](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2023-36036) Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (7.8 high)
  * publicly disclosed: [CVE-2023-36413](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2023-36413) Microsoft Office Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (6.5 medium)
  * publicly disclosed: [CVE-2023-36038](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2023-36038) ASP.NET Core Denial of Service Vulnerability (8.2 high)

posts.content:
**Cisco** is late with Patch Tuesday updates. They published five security
advisories:

  1. [Cisco Secure Client Software Denial of Service Vulnerabilities](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-accsc-dos-9SLzkZ8) CVE-2023-20240 CVE-2023-20241 (5.5 medium)
  2. [Cisco IP Phone Stored Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-uipphone-xss-NcmUykqA) CVE-2023-20265 (5.5 medium)
  3. [Cisco Secure Endpoint for Windows Scanning Evasion Vulnerability](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-secure-endpoint-dos-RzOgFKnd) CVE-2023-20084 (5.0 medium)
  4. [Cisco Identity Services Engine Vulnerabilities](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-ise-mult-j-KxpNynR) CVE-2023-20208 (4.8 medium) CVE-2023-20272 (6.7 medium)
  5. [Cisco AppDynamics PHP Agent Privilege Escalation Vulnerability](https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-appd-php-authpriv-gEBwTvu5) CVE-2023-20274 (6.3 medium)

Luckily for all 5 security advisoriies: _"The Cisco Product Security Incident
Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious
use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory."_

CVE-2023-20265.description: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of a small subset of Cisco IP Phones could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the interface on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user of an affected interface to view a page containing malicious HTML or script content. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary script code in the context of the affected interface or access sensitive, browser-based information. To exploit this vulnerability, the attacker must have valid credentials to access the web-based management interface of the affected device.

CVE-2023-20272.description: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Identity Services Engine could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to upload malicious files to the web root of the application. This vulnerability is due to insufficient file input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by uploading a malicious file to the web interface. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to replace files and gain access to sensitive server-side information.

CVE-2023-20274.description:
A vulnerability in the installer script of Cisco AppDynamics PHP Agent could allow an authenticated, local attacker to elevate privileges on an affected device.
 This vulnerability is due to insufficient permissions that are set by the PHP Agent Installer on the PHP Agent install directory. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by modifying objects in the PHP Agent install directory, which would run with the same privileges as PHP. A successful exploit could allow a lower-privileged attacker to elevate their privileges to root on an affected device.

posts.content:
**Citrix** is fashionably late to Patch Tuesday. Their security advisory is
for Citrix Hypervisor:

  * CVE-2023-23583 (CVSS: 8.8 high severity) This issue may allow unprivileged code in a guest VM to compromise that VM and, potentially, the host. CVE-2023-23583 only affects systems running on Intel Ice Lake or later CPUs.
  * CVE-2023-46835 (unknown CVSS score) An issue has been discovered that affects Citrix Hypervisor 8.2 CU1 LTSR and may allow malicious privileged code in a guest VM to compromise an AMD-based host via a passed through PCI device. CVE-2023-46835 only affects systems that have both of i) a PCI device passed through to the guest VM by the host administrator and also ii) an AMD CPU.

 **Link:** [https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX583037/citrix-hypervisor-
security-bulletin-for-cve202323583-and-
cve202346835](https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX583037/citrix-hypervisor-
security-bulletin-for-cve202323583-and-cve202346835)

posts.content:
**Google TAG:** Zimbra 0-day used to target international government
organizations  
In June 2023, Google’s Threat Analysis Group (TAG) discovered an in-the-wild
0-day exploit targeting Zimbra Collaboration, an email server many
organizations use to host their email. Since discovering the 0-day, now
patched as CVE-2023-37580, TAG has observed four different groups exploiting
the same bug to steal email data, user credentials, and authentication tokens.
Most of this activity occurred after the initial fix became public on Github.
To ensure protection against these types of exploits, TAG urges users and
organizations to keep software fully up-to-date and apply security updates as
soon as they become available.  
 **Link:** [https://blog.google/threat-analysis-group/zimbra-0-day-used-to-
target-international-government-organizations/](https://blog.google/threat-
analysis-group/zimbra-0-day-used-to-target-international-government-
organizations/)

EDIT: [CVE-2023-37580](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-37580)
(CVSSv3: 6.1 medium) cross-site scripting vulnerability in Zimbra Classic Web
Client. Disclosed 13 July by [Zimbra](https://info.zimbra.com/security-update-
zimbra-collaboration-suite-version-8.8.15-important) as an exploited zero-day,
added to CISA's [Known Exploited Vulnerabilities](https://www.cisa.gov/news-
events/alerts/2023/07/27/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog)
(KEV) Catalog on 27 July.

CVE-2021-39184.description: Electron is a framework for writing cross-platform desktop applications using JavaScript, HTML and CSS. A vulnerability in versions prior to 11.5.0, 12.1.0, and 13.3.0 allows a sandboxed renderer to request a "thumbnail" image of an arbitrary file on the user's system. The thumbnail can potentially include significant parts of the original file, including textual data in many cases. Versions 15.0.0-alpha.10, 14.0.0, 13.3.0, 12.1.0, and 11.5.0 all contain a fix for the vulnerability. Two workarounds aside from upgrading are available. One may make the vulnerability significantly more difficult for an attacker to exploit by enabling `contextIsolation` in one's app. One may also disable the functionality of the `createThumbnailFromPath` API if one does not need it.

posts.content:
**Cofense** reports on a new malware phishing campaign that is delivering
DarkGate and PikaBot, following the same tactics that have been used in QakBot
phishing campaigns. The campaign is now using evasive tactics and anti-
analysis techniques. The threat actors disseminate phishing emails through
hijacked email threads that may be obtained from Microsoft ProxyLogon attacks
CVE-2021-26855. No IOC.  
 **Link:** [https://cofense.com/blog/are-darkgate-and-pikabot-the-new-
qakbot/](https://cofense.com/blog/are-darkgate-and-pikabot-the-new-qakbot/)
(see related [The Hacker News
reporting](https://thehackernews.com/2023/11/darkgate-and-pikabot-malware-
resurrect.html))

posts.content:
**Microsoft Security Response Center** (MSRC) published two security
advisories:

  * [CVE-2023-36013](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2023-36013) PowerShell Information Disclosure Vulnerability (CVSS 6.5 medium, disclosed 17 November 2023) The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is data inside the targeted website like IDs, tokens, nonces, and other sensitive information.
  * [CVE-2023-36560](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2023-36560) ASP.NET Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (8.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2023) The attacker could send a specially crafted request that would enable them to access parts of a web application that they would not normally have access to.

Edit: Both CVE-2023-36013 and CVE-2023-36560 are marked Not Publicly
Disclosed, Not Exploited, and Exploitation Less Likely.

posts.content:
Here's a link to CISA's Malware Analysis Report (MAR):
[https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/analysis-
reports/ar23-325a](https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/analysis-
reports/ar23-325a)  
Responding to the recently disclosed CVE-2023-4966, affecting Citrix NetScaler
ADC and NetScaler Gateway appliances, CISA received four files for analysis
that show files being used to save registry hives, dump the Local Security
Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS) process memory to disk, and attempts to
establish sessions via Windows Remote Management (WinRM).

posts.content:
Here's a link to CISA's Malware Analysis Report (MAR):
[https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/analysis-
reports/ar23-325a](https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/analysis-
reports/ar23-325a)  
Responding to the recently disclosed CVE-2023-4966, affecting Citrix NetScaler
ADC and NetScaler Gateway appliances, CISA received four files for analysis
that show files being used to save registry hives, dump the Local Security
Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS) process memory to disk, and attempts to
establish sessions via Windows Remote Management (WinRM).

posts.content:
**CISA** , FBI, MS-ISAC, and ASD’s ACSC Release Advisory
[#StopRansomware](https://infosec.exchange/tags/StopRansomware): LockBit
Ransomware Affiliates Exploit CVE-2023-4966 Citrix Bleed Vulnerability (along
with an accompanying analysis report MAR-10478915-1.v1 Citrix Bleed), in
response to LockBit 3.0 ransomware affiliates and multiple threat actor groups
exploiting CVE-2023-4966. Labeled Citrix Bleed, the vulnerability affects
Citrix’s NetScaler web application delivery control (ADC) and NetScaler
Gateway appliances.  
 **Link:** [https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2023/11/21/cisa-fbi-ms-
isac-and-asds-acsc-release-advisory-lockbit-affiliates-exploiting-citrix-

[#ransomware](https://tech.lgbt/tags/ransomware) war, researcher laments,
20231114,  
by Dan G,

winning-the-ransomware-war-researcher-
laments/](https://arstechnica.com/security/2023/11/teens-with-digital-
bazookas-are-winning-the-ransomware-war-researcher-laments/)  
[#lockBit](https://tech.lgbt/tags/lockBit)

『What do Boeing, an Australian shipping company, the world’s largest bank, and
one of the world’s biggest law firms have in common?  
[...]  
All [Boeing, DP World, Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, Allen & Overy]
of the companies, Beaumont
[[https://cyberplace.social/@GossiTheDog](https://cyberplace.social/@GossiTheDog)]
said, were users of a networking product known as
[#Citrix](https://tech.lgbt/tags/Citrix)
[#Netscaler](https://tech.lgbt/tags/Netscaler) and hadn’t patched against a
critical [#vulnerability](https://tech.lgbt/tags/vulnerability)
[[#CitrixBleed](https://tech.lgbt/tags/CitrixBleed),
[#CVE2023_4966](https://tech.lgbt/tags/CVE2023_4966)] despite a patch being
available since October 10.』

account.note:
@threatresearch OR @threatresearch

Principal Meat Popsicle @SophosXOps, researching and writing about malware, network forensics, and the intersection of crime with anything that electrons flow through.

Sophos' representative to the Cyber Threat Alliance (CTA), a threat intelligence sharing network whose members comprise most of the infosec industry's largest companies.

Volunteer docent and astromech droid for ancient technology at @mediaarchaeologylab - I break robust modern computers and act as caregiver to the old, fragile ones.

I use this account for posting about professional and infosec stuff. Personal account is @spike

posts.content:
New [#CitrixBleed](https://cyberplace.social/tags/CitrixBleed) blog (where the
vendor has moved it from Citrix.com to a different website).

Essential point is run the commands to kill active sessions. I have more to
come on this point, somebody harvested session tokens from almost every box on
the internet.

[https://www.netscaler.com/blog/news/netscaler-investigation-recommendations-
for-cve-2023-4966/](https://www.netscaler.com/blog/news/netscaler-

posts.content:
Citrix has published a blog post to remind owners of NetScaler and ADC
appliances to not only update its software but also wipe past user sessions.
This step is necessary because threat actors who exploit the CitrixBleed
vulnerability will steal authentication tokens that they can use later after
the device has been patched.

[https://www.netscaler.com/blog/news/netscaler-investigation-recommendations-
for-cve-2023-4966/](https://www.netscaler.com/blog/news/netscaler-
investigation-recommendations-for-cve-2023-4966/)

posts.content:
New by [@carlypage](https://mastodon.social/@carlypage): Hackers are
exploiting 'CitrixBleed' bug in the latest wave of mass cyberattacks.

'CitrixBleed' requires little effort or complexity to exploit, allowing
hackers to break into a victim’s network without a password or using two-
factor.

The LockBit ransomware gang has taken credit for hacking big-name firms.

“We would expect CVE-2023-4966 to be one of the top routinely exploited
vulnerabilities from 2023," said Rapid7's Caitlin Condon.

More: [https://techcrunch.com/2023/11/14/citrix-bleed-critical-bug-ransomware-
mass-cyberattacks](https://techcrunch.com/2023/11/14/citrix-bleed-critical-
bug-ransomware-mass-cyberattacks)

posts.content:
PoC pubblico per lo sfruttamento della CVE-2023-4911 (AL02/231006/CSIRT-ITA) -
Aggiornamento

🔗️ [Csirt] [https://link.is.it/of3j92](https://link.is.it/of3j92)

CVE-2023-4911.description: A buffer overflow was discovered in the GNU C Library's dynamic loader ld.so while processing the GLIBC_TUNABLES environment variable. This issue could allow a local attacker to use maliciously crafted GLIBC_TUNABLES environment variables when launching binaries with SUID permission to execute code with elevated privileges.

posts.content:
**Trend Micro** reports active exploitation of the Apache ActiveMQ
vulnerability CVE-2023-46604 (CVSS: 10.0 critical severity, reported exploited
as a zero-day since at least 10 October 2023, disclosed 26 October by Apache,
Proof of Concept available, added to CISA's KEV Catalog on 02 November) to
download and infect Linux systems with the Kinsing malware (also known as
h2miner) and cryptocurrency miner. Trend Micro describes the Kinsing attack
chain and provide IOC.  
 **Link:**
[https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/23/k/cve-2023-46604-exploited-by-
kinsing.html](https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/23/k/cve-2023-46604-exploited-
by-kinsing.html)

posts.content:
**Trend Micro** reports active exploitation of the Apache ActiveMQ
vulnerability CVE-2023-46604 (CVSS: 10.0 critical severity, reported exploited
as a zero-day since at least 10 October 2023, disclosed 26 October by Apache,
Proof of Concept available, added to CISA's KEV Catalog on 02 November) to
download and infect Linux systems with the Kinsing malware (also known as
h2miner) and cryptocurrency miner. Trend Micro describes the Kinsing attack
chain and provide IOC.

[https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/23/k/cve-2023-46604-exploited-by-
kinsing.html](https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/23/k/cve-2023-46604-exploited-

CVE-2023-46604.description:
The Java OpenWire protocol marshaller is vulnerable to Remote Code 
Execution. This vulnerability may allow a remote attacker with network 
access to either a Java-based OpenWire broker or client to run arbitrary
 shell commands by manipulating serialized class types in the OpenWire 
protocol to cause either the client or the broker (respectively) to 
instantiate any class on the classpath.

Users are recommended to upgrade
 both brokers and clients to version 5.15.16, 5.16.7, 5.17.6, or 5.18.3 
which fixes this issue.

posts.content:
**Mozilla** Foundation released four security advisories:

  * 10 Security Vulnerabilities fixed in [Firefox 120](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/advisories/mfsa2023-49/)
  * 7 Security Vulnerabilities fixed in [Firefox ESR 115.5](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/advisories/mfsa2023-50/)
  * 2 Security Vulnerabilities fixed in [Firefox for iOS 120](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/advisories/mfsa2023-51/)
  * 7 Security Vulnerabilities fixed in [Thunderbird 115.5.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/advisories/mfsa2023-52/)

At a glance, a mix of high/moderate/low severity vulnerabilities with no
mention of exploitation in the wild or proofs of concept. However,
CVE-2023-6212 had some questionable wording: _"Some of these bugs showed
evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of
these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code."_

[#Mozilla](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Mozilla)
[#Firefox](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Firefox)
[#vulnerability](https://infosec.exchange/tags/vulnerability)
[#PatchTuesday](https://infosec.exchange/tags/PatchTuesday)

CVE-2023-6212.description: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 119, Firefox 115.4, and Thunderbird 115.4. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 120, Firefox < 115.5, and Thunderbird < 115.5.0.

posts.content:
Post copied here for those who don't wish to go to threads (credit to Kevin):

If you run CrushFTP you probably want to patch CVE-2023-43177, a CVSS 9.7 pre-
auth RCE vulnerability in an enterprise MFT product. These tend to be targeted
by ransomware groups.The vendor released a patch 3 months ago but failed to
issue a CVE until this Friday.  
Writeup: [https://convergetp.com/2023/11/16/crushftp-zero-day-
cve-2023-43177-discovered](https://convergetp.com/2023/11/16/crushftp-zero-
day-cve-2023-43177-discovered)  
I cannot find a public proof of concept exploit and there's a good degree of
complexity to exploit so you have a patching window.

posts.content:
Today's edition of what grabbed my threaty eye during morning coffee
([#WGMTEDMC](https://infosec.exchange/tags/WGMTEDMC)):

Increased chatter about Apache RocketMQ is resulting in more attempts to
exploit CVE-2023-33246, a remote code execution vulnerability.

[https://viz.greynoise.io/tag/apache-rocketmq-rce-
attempt?days=30](https://viz.greynoise.io/tag/apache-rocketmq-rce-
attempt?days=30)

CVE-2023-33246.description:
For RocketMQ versions 5.1.0 and below, under certain conditions, there is a risk of remote command execution. 

Several components of RocketMQ, including NameServer, Broker, and Controller, are leaked on the extranet and lack permission verification, an attacker can exploit this vulnerability by using the update configuration function to execute commands as the system users that RocketMQ is running as. Additionally, an attacker can achieve the same effect by forging the RocketMQ protocol content. 

To prevent these attacks, users are recommended to upgrade to version 5.1.1 or above for using RocketMQ 5.x or 4.9.6 or above for using RocketMQ 4.x .

posts.content:
**NSFOCUS** provides a threat actor profile of the newly named APT
"DarkCasino", the cybercriminal group who developed/exploited the WinRAR zero-
day CVE-2023-38831 (7.8 high, publicly disclosed 23 August 2023 by Group-IB,
added to KEV Catalog 24 August, arbitrary code execution zero-day in RARLAB’s
WinRAR before 6.23). DarkCasino is a financially motivated APT that targets
staff and users of online trading platforms, specifically in cryptocurrency
trading, online casinos, and global network banking. Their main attack vectors
are watering hole attacks and spearphishing. DarkCasino's attack chain is
described. NSFOCUS decided to cover CVE-2023-38831 exploitation by other
threat actors, including APTs like DarkPink, Konni (North Korean), GhostWriter
(suspected Belarusian). IOC for those provided.  
 **Link:** [https://nsfocusglobal.com/the-new-apt-group-darkcasino-and-the-
global-surge-in-winrar-0-day-exploits/](https://nsfocusglobal.com/the-new-apt-
group-darkcasino-and-the-global-surge-in-winrar-0-day-exploits/) See related
[The Hacker News reporting](https://thehackernews.com/2023/11/experts-uncover-
darkcasino-new-emerging.html)

posts.content:
The latest report from the National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine
looks into a recent APT29 campaign in which the actor leveraged WinRAR
vulnerability CVE-2023-38831 to target embassy entities in multiple European
nations (Azerbaijan, Greece, Romania & Italy).
[https://www.rnbo.gov.ua/files/2023_YEAR/CYBERCENTER/november/APT29%20attacks%20Embassies%20using%20CVE-2023-38831%20-%20report%20en.pdf](https://www.rnbo.gov.ua/files/2023_YEAR/CYBERCENTER/november/APT29%20attacks%20Embassies%20using%20CVE-2023-38831%20-%20report%20en.pdf)

CVE-2023-38831.description: RARLAB WinRAR before 6.23 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code when a user attempts to view a benign file within a ZIP archive. The issue occurs because a ZIP archive may include a benign file (such as an ordinary .JPG file) and also a folder that has the same name as the benign file, and the contents of the folder (which may include executable content) are processed during an attempt to access only the benign file. This was exploited in the wild in April through October 2023.

posts.content:
第200回 これは通過点なんだ！スペシャル！ « podcast -
[#セキュリティのアレ](https://infosec.exchange/tags/%E3%82%BB%E3%82%AD%E3%83%A5%E3%83%AA%E3%83%86%E3%82%A3%E3%81%AE%E3%82%A2%E3%83%AC)
[https://www.tsujileaks.com/?p=1635](https://www.tsujileaks.com/?p=1635) 収録日:
2023年11月12日

第200回おめでとうございます！僕も周りにアレをオススメしているので、知らぬ前に周りにアレ勢が増えている気がします。

今まで一番良かった回は決められませんが、印象に残った回は「第179回 続きはどこかのセミナーで！スペシャル」です

SysAid On-Premにおけるパストラバーサルの脆弱性:
CVE-2023-47246／いなげやなどのQRコードにおける短縮URLの問題／SLP(Service Location Protocol)による脆弱性:
CVE-2023-47246

いなげやの事例はQRコード提供者・短縮URL提供者、ユーザの事情およびマルウェア配布にも悪用されるインターネット広告の状況など様々な要因が関連したように思い、興味深いです。また、SLPの脆弱性を見落としていたので知れてよかったです

[@avoidthehack](https://infosec.exchange/@avoidthehack)

posts.content:
[@musevg](https://chaos.social/@musevg)  
Du meinst sicher die Follina Lücke. ([https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-
guide/vulnerability/CVE-2022-30190](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-
guide/vulnerability/CVE-2022-30190)) Ich habe dazu auch einen Exploit gebaut,
um dann Gegenmaßnahmen einzuleiten und zu testen. Wir hatten die
Gegenmaßnahmen ausgerollt als Heise ihren Artikel draußen hatte.

Microsoft ist leider nicht in der Lage ein Dokumentenformat bzw. ein Office zu
bauen, das in der Standardeinstellung sicher betrieben werden kann. Sie haben
sogar "Mark of the Web" erfunden, um Dateien als "aus dem Internet" zu
kennzeichnen. Daher verschicken einige Ransomeware Gangs ISOs. Wenn man das
einlegt (geht ja mittlerweile automatisch) und die Dateien dort öffnet, dann
kommen sie ja von CD. 🤡​

Also ist die Maßnahme Anhänge im Format ISO zu blocken. Oder man schickt sie
in die Quarantäne, falls es wirklich Leute geben sollte, die sich ISOs per
Mail schicken lassen.

posts.content:
The 'sxadm status' command in
[#OracleSolaris](https://fosstodon.org/tags/OracleSolaris) 11.4.63 has added
two new extensions that it reports on.

BTC_NO is reported for AMD CPUs that are not susceptible to the Branch Type
Confusion vulnerability (CVE-2022-23825).

SMEP is reported for Intel & AMD CPUs which have enabled Supervisor Mode
Execution Prevention. (SMEP has been enabled since Oracle Solaris 11.1 on
Intel's Ivy Bridge and later processors, but was not previously reported by
the sxadm command. AMD support came later.)

CVE-2022-23825.description: Aliases in the branch predictor may cause some AMD processors to predict the wrong branch type potentially leading to information disclosure.

posts.content:
Based on npm download statistics, around 35% of sharp users have upgraded to
using the latest v0.32.6.

From today onwards, "npm audit" will start to nag you about upgrading if
you're still using an older version of sharp that provides a version of
libwebp vulnerable to CVE-2023-4863.

CVE-2023-4863.description: Heap buffer overflow in libwebp in Google Chrome prior to 116.0.5845.187 and libwebp 1.3.2 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Critical)

posts.content:
**Microsoft** Security Response Center (MSRC) published 4 security
advisories:

  * [CVE-2023-36026](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2023-36026) (CVSSv3:4.3 medium severity) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability. In the FAQ section, it states that "The user would have to click on a specially crafted URL to be compromised by the attacker. The attacker is able to bypass the warning on the permissions message when visiting a potentially malicious website. (Loss of Integrity:Low)"
  * [CVE-2023-36008](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2023-36008) (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. In the FAQ section, it states that "The performance can be interrupted and/or reduced, but the attacker cannot fully deny service (Loss of Availability:Low). The attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could have limited ability to perform code execution (Loss of Integrity:Low)."
  * [CVE-2023-5997](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2023-5997) Chromium: CVE-2023-5997 Use after free in Garbage Collection. It does not contain more information than included in Google Chrome's [security advisory](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/11/stable-channel-update-for-desktop_14.html).
  * [CVE-2023-6112](https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2023-6112) Chromium: CVE-2023-6112 Use after free in Navigation. Same as CVE-2023-5997 above this.

CVE-2023-36026 and CVE-2023-36008 are marked Not Publicly Disclosed, Not
Exploited and Exploitation Less Likely. In Google Chrome's [security
advisory](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023/11/stable-channel-update-
for-desktop_14.html) for CVE-2023-5997 and CVE-2023-6112, there was no mention
of exploitation.

posts.content:
[@BleepingComputer](https://infosec.exchange/@BleepingComputer) Fortinet's
[security advisory](https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-135) gives a
different CVSSv3 score compared to what they as the CNA provided [NIST and
NVD](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-36553).

Examining the vector for CVE-2023-36553:
CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H still shows how serious the
vulnerability is. Scope:Unchanged is the only thing keeping this from being a
10.0

Edit: I was starting to doubt Fortinet's CVSS scores when they labeled the
TunnelCrack vulnerability CVE-2023-36671 as a
[6](https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-383) when it's
[6.3](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-36671). Most of the security
advisories published 14 November 2023 by Fortinet have the incorrect CVSS
scores.

posts.content:
Continuing with our celebration of Patch Tuesday, **Fortinet** released 20
security advisories. I'm not going to link all 20, so I'll summarize. Variety
of products affected. The highest CVSSv3 score is CVE-2023-36553 ( **9.3
critical** severity) FortiSIEM - OS command injection in Report Server; and
CVE-2023-34991 (also **9.3 critical** ) FortiWLM - Unauthenticated SQL
Injection Vulnerability. Interestingly, curl and libcurl CVE-2023-38545 and
CVE-2023-38546 vulnerabilities have an advisory, as well as TunneCrack VPN
vulnerability CVE-2023-36671. No mention of exploitation or proofs of concept.  
 **Link** to general PSIRT Advisories:
[https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt](https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt)

[#PatchTuesday](https://infosec.exchange/tags/PatchTuesday)
[#Fortinet](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Fortinet)

[#CVE202334991](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE202334991)
[#CVE202336553](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE202336553)
[#CVE202336671](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE202336671)
[#CVE202338545](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE202338545)
[#CVE202338546](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE202338546)

CVE-2023-36671.description: An issue was discovered in the Clario VPN client through 5.9.1.1662 for macOS. The VPN client insecurely configures the operating system such that all IP traffic to the VPN server's IP address is sent in plaintext outside the VPN tunnel even if this traffic is not generated by the VPN client. This allows an adversary to trick the victim into sending plaintext traffic to the VPN server's IP address and thereby deanonymize the victim. NOTE: the tunnelcrack.mathyvanhoef.com website uses this CVE ID to refer more generally to "ServerIP attack for only traffic to the real IP address of the VPN server" rather than to only Clario.

posts.content:
**Denmark** 's CERT (SektorCERT) reported that 22 companies that operate
parts of Danish energy infrastructure were compromised in a May 2023
coordinated attack, linked to SANDWORM actors. Sandworm is a state-sponsored
APT publicly attributed to Russian General Staff Main Intelligence
Directorate’s Russian (GRU’s) Main Centre for Special Technologies (GTsST) by
the U.S. government. The attackers leveraged a Zyxel vulnerability
CVE-2023-28771 (9.8 critical) to gain control of the firewall. SektorCERT's
incident response report includes a detailed analysis and timeline of the
attack, recommendations and IOC.  
 **Link:** [https://media.licdn.com/dms/document/media/D4D1FAQG-

analyzed/0/1699785104486?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=icNMQ-

CVE-2023-34062.description:
In Reactor Netty HTTP Server, versions 1.1.x prior to 1.1.13 and versions 1.0.x prior to 1.0.39, a malicious user can send a request using a specially crafted URL that can lead to a directory traversal attack.

Specifically, an application is vulnerable if Reactor Netty HTTP Server is configured to serve static resources.

posts.content:
Continuing with our celebration of Patch Tuesday: **VMware** has a security
advisory for VMware Cloud Director Appliance. CVE-2023-34060 ( **9.8
critical** severity) _"VMware Cloud Director Appliance contains an
authentication bypass vulnerability in case VMware Cloud Director Appliance
was upgraded to 10.5 from an older version... On an upgraded version of VMware
Cloud Director Appliance 10.5, a malicious actor with network access to the
appliance can bypass login restrictions when authenticating on port 22 (ssh)
or port 5480 (appliance management console) . This bypass is not present on
port 443 (VCD provider and tenant login). On a new installation of VMware
Cloud Director Appliance 10.5, the bypass is not present."_ No mention of
exploitation.

 **Link:**
[https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2023-0026.html](https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2023-0026.html)

[#PatchTuesday](https://infosec.exchange/tags/PatchTuesday)
[#VMware](https://infosec.exchange/tags/VMware)
[#VMwareCloudDirectorAppliance](https://infosec.exchange/tags/VMwareCloudDirectorAppliance)
[#vulnerability](https://infosec.exchange/tags/vulnerability)
[#CVE202334060](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE202334060)

CVE-2023-34060.description:
VMware Cloud Director Appliance contains an authentication bypass vulnerability in case VMware Cloud Director Appliance was upgraded to 10.5 from
an older version. On an upgraded version of VMware Cloud Director Appliance 10.5, a malicious actor with network access to the appliance can bypass login
restrictions when authenticating on port 22 (ssh) or port 5480 (appliance management console) . This bypass is not present on port 443 (VCD provider
and tenant login). On a new installation of VMware Cloud Director Appliance 10.5, the bypass is not present. VMware Cloud Director Appliance is impacted since it uses an affected version of sssd from the underlying Photon OS. The sssd issue is no longer present in versions of Photon OS that ship with sssd-2.8.1-11 or higher (Photon OS 3) or sssd-2.8.2-9 or higher (Photon OS 4 and 5).

posts.content:
Our [#usdHeroLab](https://infosec.exchange/tags/usdHeroLab)
[#Pentest](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Pentest) professionals analyzed
[#GibbonEdu](https://infosec.exchange/tags/GibbonEdu) during their pentests.  
1⃣Vulnerability Type: Arbitrary File Write
[#CWE434](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CWE434)  
🚨 Security Risk: Critical  
🔎CVE number: CVE-2023-45878  
🧵👇 More Details

🧐 Gibbon Edu is an [#opensource](https://infosec.exchange/tags/opensource)
educational software designed for
[#schools](https://infosec.exchange/tags/schools) and
[#institutions](https://infosec.exchange/tags/institutions) to manage their
administrative and academic processes. It offers a range of features to
facilitate communication, collaboration, and organization within the
educational community.

The identified vulnerability allowed unauthenticated attackers to upload
arbitrary files to the application and receive code execution on the
underlying system. To receive [#RCE](https://infosec.exchange/tags/RCE) an
attacker must craft a fake image which can be stored as PHP file.

The vulnerability was reported to the vendor under the Responsible Disclosure
Policy and subsequently fixed for
[#moresecurity](https://infosec.exchange/tags/moresecurity). More information
can be found here 🧑‍💻👩‍💻👇  
[https://herolab.usd.de/security-
advisories/usd-2023-0025/](https://herolab.usd.de/security-
advisories/usd-2023-0025/)

CVE-2023-45878.description: GibbonEdu Gibbon version 25.0.1 and before allows Arbitrary File Write because rubrics_visualise_saveAjax.phps does not require authentication. The endpoint accepts the img, path, and gibbonPersonID parameters. The img parameter is expected to be a base64 encoded image. If the path parameter is set, the defined path is used as the destination folder, concatenated with the absolute path of the installation directory. The content of the img parameter is base64 decoded and written to the defined file path. This allows creation of PHP files that permit Remote Code Execution (unauthenticated).

posts.content:
Continuing with our celebration of Patch Tuesday, **Fortinet** released 20
security advisories. I'm not going to link all 20, so I'll summarize. Variety
of products affected. The highest CVSSv3 score is CVE-2023-36553 ( **9.3
critical** severity) FortiSIEM - OS command injection in Report Server; and
CVE-2023-34991 (also **9.3 critical** ) FortiWLM - Unauthenticated SQL
Injection Vulnerability. Interestingly, curl and libcurl CVE-2023-38545 and
CVE-2023-38546 vulnerabilities have an advisory, as well as TunneCrack VPN
vulnerability CVE-2023-36671. No mention of exploitation or proofs of concept.  
 **Link** to general PSIRT Advisories:
[https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt](https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/psirt)

[#PatchTuesday](https://infosec.exchange/tags/PatchTuesday)
[#Fortinet](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Fortinet)
[#vulnerability](https://infosec.exchange/tags/vulnerability)
[#CVE202334991](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE202334991)
[#CVE202336553](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE202336553)
[#CVE202336671](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE202336671)
[#CVE202338545](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE202338545)
[#CVE202338546](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE202338546)

CVE-2023-38546.description:
This flaw allows an attacker to insert cookies at will into a running program
using libcurl, if the specific series of conditions are met.

libcurl performs transfers. In its API, an application creates "easy handles"
that are the individual handles for single transfers.

libcurl provides a function call that duplicates en easy handle called
[curl_easy_duphandle](https://curl.se/libcurl/c/curl_easy_duphandle.html).

If a transfer has cookies enabled when the handle is duplicated, the
cookie-enable state is also cloned - but without cloning the actual
cookies. If the source handle did not read any cookies from a specific file on
disk, the cloned version of the handle would instead store the file name as
`none` (using the four ASCII letters, no quotes).

Subsequent use of the cloned handle that does not explicitly set a source to
load cookies from would then inadvertently load cookies from a file named
`none` - if such a file exists and is readable in the current directory of the
program using libcurl. And if using the correct file format of course.

CVE-2023-38545.description:
This flaw makes curl overflow a heap based buffer in the SOCKS5 proxy
handshake.

When curl is asked to pass along the host name to the SOCKS5 proxy to allow
that to resolve the address instead of it getting done by curl itself, the
maximum length that host name can be is 255 bytes.

If the host name is detected to be longer, curl switches to local name
resolving and instead passes on the resolved address only. Due to this bug,
the local variable that means "let the host resolve the name" could get the
wrong value during a slow SOCKS5 handshake, and contrary to the intention,
copy the too long host name to the target buffer instead of copying just the
resolved address there.

The target buffer being a heap based buffer, and the host name coming from the
URL that curl has been told to operate with.

CVE-2023-36851.description:
A Missing Authentication for Critical Function vulnerability in Juniper Networks Junos OS on SRX Series allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to cause limited impact to the file system integrity.



With a specific request to 

webauth_operation.php

that doesn't require authentication, an attacker is able to upload arbitrary files via J-Web, leading to a loss of 

integrity

for a certain part of the file system, which may allow chaining to other vulnerabilities.


This issue affects Juniper Networks Junos OS on SRX Series:



  *  22.4 versions prior to 22,4R2-S2, 22.4R3;
  *  23.2 versions prior to 23.2R2.

CVE-2023-36847.description:
A Missing Authentication for Critical Function vulnerability in Juniper Networks Junos OS on EX Series allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to cause limited impact to the file system integrity.





With a specific request to installAppPackage.php that doesn't require authentication an attacker is able to upload arbitrary files via J-Web, leading to a loss of 

integrity

for a certain 

part of the file system, which may allow chaining to other vulnerabilities.


This issue affects Juniper Networks Junos OS on EX Series:



  *  All versions prior to 20.4R3-S8;
  *  21.1 versions 21.1R1 and later;
  *  21.2 versions prior to 21.2R3-S6;
  *  21.3 versions 

prior to 

 21.3R3-S5;
  *  21.4 versions 

prior to 

21.4R3-S4;
  *  22.1 versions 

prior to 

22.1R3-S3;
  *  22.2 versions 

prior to 

22.2R3-S1;
  *  22.3 versions 

prior to 

22.3R2-S2, 22.3R3;
  *  22.4 versions 

prior to 

22.4R2-S1, 22.4R3.

posts.content:
**SentinelOne** is currently monitoring increased exploitation of
CVE-2023-22518 ( **10.0 critical** severity, disclosed 31 October 2023 by
Atlassian, added to CISA's KEV Catalog 07 November, significant data loss).
They observed multiple campaigns leveraging the bug to deploy new C3RB3R
(Cerber) ransomware variants targeting both Windows and Linux hosts. They
detail the attack chain observed in these incidents and provide recent IOC.  
 **Link:** [https://www.sentinelone.com/blog/c3rb3r-ransomware-ongoing-
exploitation-of-cve-2023-22518-targets-unpatched-confluence-
servers/](https://www.sentinelone.com/blog/c3rb3r-ransomware-ongoing-
exploitation-of-cve-2023-22518-targets-unpatched-confluence-servers/)

CVE-2023-22518.description:
All versions of Confluence Data Center and Server are affected by this unexploited vulnerability. This Improper Authorization vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to reset Confluence and create a Confluence instance administrator account. Using this account, an attacker can then perform all administrative actions that are available to Confluence instance administrator leading to - but not limited to - full loss of confidentiality, integrity and availability. 

Atlassian Cloud sites are not affected by this vulnerability. If your Confluence site is accessed via an atlassian.net domain, it is hosted by Atlassian and is not vulnerable to this issue.

posts.content:
The security team at consulting firm AON has published an analysis of
Effluence, a backdoor planted on Atlassian Confluence servers that have been
exploited using the CVE-2023-22515 vulnerability.

The zero-day was used by a suspected Chinese APT (Storm-0062) in limited
attacks since mid-September. AON did not attribute the backdoor to any threat
actor yet.

[https://www.aon.com/cyber-solutions/aon_cyber_labs/detecting-effluence-an-
unauthenticated-confluence-web-shell/](https://www.aon.com/cyber-
solutions/aon_cyber_labs/detecting-effluence-an-unauthenticated-confluence-
web-shell/)

posts.content:
**Aon** identified a unique Atlassian Confluence backdoor that persists even
after patching CVE-2023-22515. It grants persistent remote access to every web
page on the server, including the unauthenticated login page, without the need
for a valid user account. The web shell (dubbed "Effluence") is passive,
allowing requests to pass through it unnoticed until a request matching a
specific parameter is provided, at which point it triggers its malicious
behavior by executing a series of actions. No IOC, but detection methods and
YARA Rule provided.  
 **Links:** [https://www.aon.com/cyber-solutions/aon_cyber_labs/detecting-
effluence-an-unauthenticated-confluence-web-shell/](https://www.aon.com/cyber-
solutions/aon_cyber_labs/detecting-effluence-an-unauthenticated-confluence-
web-shell/) and [https://thehackernews.com/2023/11/alert-effluence-backdoor-
persists.html](https://thehackernews.com/2023/11/alert-effluence-backdoor-
persists.html)

[#AtlassianConfluence](https://infosec.exchange/tags/AtlassianConfluence)
[#CVE202322515](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE202322515)
[#Effluence](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Effluence)

CVE-2023-22515.description:
Atlassian has been made aware of an issue reported by a handful of customers where external attackers may have exploited a previously unknown vulnerability in publicly accessible Confluence Data Center and Server instances to create unauthorized Confluence administrator accounts and access Confluence instances. 

Atlassian Cloud sites are not affected by this vulnerability. If your Confluence site is accessed via an atlassian.net domain, it is hosted by Atlassian and is not vulnerable to this issue.

posts.content:
Rilevato sfruttamento in rete della CVE-2023-20198 relativa al software Cisco
IOS XE (AL03/231016/CSIRT-ITA) - Aggiornamento

🔗️ [Csirt] [https://link.is.it/5zwqbm](https://link.is.it/5zwqbm)

CVE-2023-20198.description: Cisco is providing an update for the ongoing investigation into observed exploitation of the web UI feature in Cisco IOS XE Software. We are updating the list of fixed releases and adding the Software Checker. Our investigation has determined that the actors exploited two previously unknown issues. The attacker first exploited CVE-2023-20198 to gain initial access and issued a privilege 15 command to create a local user and password combination. This allowed the user to log in with normal user access. The attacker then exploited another component of the web UI feature, leveraging the new local user to elevate privilege to root and write the implant to the file system. Cisco has assigned CVE-2023-20273 to this issue. CVE-2023-20198 has been assigned a CVSS Score of 10.0. CVE-2023-20273 has been assigned a CVSS Score of 7.2. Both of these CVEs are being tracked by CSCwh87343.

posts.content:
[@aral](https://mastodon.ar.al/@aral)
[@Codeberg](https://social.anoxinon.de/@Codeberg)
[@forgejo](https://floss.social/@forgejo) it's possible this is related to
CVEs like this one: [https://blog.rust-
lang.org/2021/11/01/cve-2021-42574.html](https://blog.rust-
lang.org/2021/11/01/cve-2021-42574.html)

But, it's certainly annoying to see warnings that a compiler/interpreter will
trip over anyway (e.g. quote symbols), because that's what CI is for

Really should only see warnings/errors for text that is both valid to the
compiler, and also conceals code from human review (per the CVE)

CVE-2021-42574.description: An issue was discovered in the Bidirectional Algorithm in the Unicode Specification through 14.0. It permits the visual reordering of characters via control sequences, which can be used to craft source code that renders different logic than the logical ordering of tokens ingested by compilers and interpreters. Adversaries can leverage this to encode source code for compilers accepting Unicode such that targeted vulnerabilities are introduced invisibly to human reviewers. NOTE: the Unicode Consortium offers the following alternative approach to presenting this concern. An issue is noted in the nature of international text that can affect applications that implement support for The Unicode Standard and the Unicode Bidirectional Algorithm (all versions). Due to text display behavior when text includes left-to-right and right-to-left characters, the visual order of tokens may be different from their logical order. Additionally, control characters needed to fully support the requirements of bidirectional text can further obfuscate the logical order of tokens. Unless mitigated, an adversary could craft source code such that the ordering of tokens perceived by human reviewers does not match what will be processed by a compiler/interpreter/etc. The Unicode Consortium has documented this class of vulnerability in its document, Unicode Technical Report #36, Unicode Security Considerations. The Unicode Consortium also provides guidance on mitigations for this class of issues in Unicode Technical Standard #39, Unicode Security Mechanisms, and in Unicode Standard Annex #31, Unicode Identifier and Pattern Syntax. Also, the BIDI specification allows applications to tailor the implementation in ways that can mitigate misleading visual reordering in program text; see HL4 in Unicode Standard Annex #9, Unicode Bidirectional Algorithm.

posts.content:
**Ivanti** security advisory: Two vulnerabilities impact all supported
versions of the products – EPMM Versions 11.10, 11.9 and 11.8 and Sentry
Versions 9.18. 9.17 and 9.16. Older versions/releases are also at risk.

  * CVE-2023-39335 (vendor 8.5 high severity) - Authenticated User enroll as another user vulnerability
  * CVE-2023-39337 (vendor 6.8 medium) - Authenticated user obtain certificate for another user vulnerability

By taking advantage of a physically stolen device insider threats who already
have a valid user certificate, or systems that have open enrollment, a threat
actor can impersonate an authenticated user to: Obtain a valid certificate for
another EPMM user; Enroll a device for another EPMM user. The vulnerabilities
can be chained to allow an unauthenticated user to access resources behind
Sentry. Because of the prerequisite information required for exploitation, the
attacker would have to be highly sophisticated to perform the attack chain.  
 **Link:** [https://www.ivanti.com/blog/ivanti-epmm-
cve-2023-39335-39337](https://www.ivanti.com/blog/ivanti-epmm-
cve-2023-39335-39337)

[#Ivanti](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Ivanti)
[#EPMM](https://infosec.exchange/tags/EPMM)
[#MobileIronCore](https://infosec.exchange/tags/MobileIronCore)
[#Vulnerability](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Vulnerability)
[#CVE202339335](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE202339335)
[#CVE202339337](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE202339337)
[#IvantiSentry](https://infosec.exchange/tags/IvantiSentry)

CVE-2023-39335.description: A security vulnerability has been identified in EPMM Versions 11.10, 11.9 and 11.8 and older allowing an unauthenticated threat actor to impersonate any existing user during the device enrollment process. This issue poses a significant security risk, as it enables unauthorized access and potential misuse of user accounts and resources.

posts.content:
**Unit 42** provides an in-depth analysis of the exploit chain used by pro-
Russian APT RomCom Group (tracked by Microsoft as Storm-0978) in a July 2023
campaign targeting groups supporting Ukraine's admission into NATO. RomCom
used a highly complex and well-developed exploit chain leveraging a remote
code execution (RCE) vulnerability in Microsoft Office designated
CVE-2023-36884 to infect its targets with malware. Unit 42's investigation
revealed a new exploit method related to it, which was assigned
CVE-2023-36584. They provide a technical analysis of the exploit chain and of
the new vulnerability. IOC provided.  
 **Link:** [https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/new-cve-2023-36584-discovered-
in-attack-chain-used-by-russian-apt/](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/new-
cve-2023-36584-discovered-in-attack-chain-used-by-russian-apt/)

posts.content:
**Rapid7** Velociraptor security advisory: CVE-2023-5950 (CVSSv3: 8.6 high
severity) Rapid7 Velociraptor versions prior to 0.7.0-4 suffer from a
reflected cross site scripting (XSS) vulnerability. This vulnerability allows
attackers to inject JS into the error path, potentially leading to
unauthorized execution of scripts within a user's web browser. This
vulnerability is fixed in version 0.7.0-4 and a patch is available to
download. Patches are also available for version 0.6.9 (0.6.9-1). This issue
affects the server only. No mention of exploitation.  
 **Link:**
[https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/11/10/cve-2023-5950-rapid7-velociraptor-
reflected-
xss/](https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2023/11/10/cve-2023-5950-rapid7-velociraptor-
reflected-xss/)

[#Rapid7](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Rapid7)
[#Velociraptor](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Velociraptor)
[#reflectedxss](https://infosec.exchange/tags/reflectedxss)
[#xss](https://infosec.exchange/tags/xss)
[#CVE20235950](https://infosec.exchange/tags/CVE20235950)
[#vulnerability](https://infosec.exchange/tags/vulnerability)

CVE-2023-5950.description: Rapid7 Velociraptor versions prior to 0.7.0-4 suffer from a reflected cross site scripting vulnerability. This vulnerability allows attackers to inject JS into the error path, potentially leading to unauthorized execution of scripts within a user's web browser. This vulnerability is fixed in version 0.7.0-04 and a patch is available to download. Patches are also available for version 0.6.9 (0.6.9-1).

QTS 5.0.1.2376 build 20230421 and later
QTS 4.5.4.2374 build 20230416 and later
QuTS hero h5.0.1.2376 build 20230421 and later
QuTS hero h4.5.4.2374 build 20230417 and later
QuTScloud c5.0.1.2374 and later

posts.content:
**ASEC** summarized 17 months of a Kimsuky operation dubbed _Operation Covert
Stalker_. Kimsuky is a nation-state APT attributed to North Korea and assessed
to be in the Reconnaissance General Burueau (RGB). In the report (Korean
language only) ASEC states that Kimsuky sends phishing emails to targets
involved in the field of North Korea, exploiting CVE-2019-0708 (9.8 critical
RDP vulnerability allowing for RCE, added to KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) and
other unidentified vulnerabilities, adding remote control programs e.g.
AnyDesk and Quasar RAT etc., and encrypting systems with BlackBit ransomware.  
 **Link:**
[https://asec.ahnlab.com/en/58654/](https://asec.ahnlab.com/en/58654/)

[#Kimsuky](https://infosec.exchange/tags/Kimsuky)

posts.content:
Ich habe eine CVE-ID am 4. Nov angefordert. Dennoch erscheint die RC
Schwachstelle nun über CVE-2023-47272, welche später und von jemand anderem
eingereicht wurde. 🤷

Nebenbei bemerkt ist diese Schwachstelle trotz der möglichen Eskalation (siehe
Video) nur mit Medium zu beziffern.

Ist zwar medium aber man könnte damit alle E-Mails eines Accounts abgreifen.

Hier zeigt sich sehr schön, warum CVSS4.0 für die Bestimmung des Base-Scores
so viel besser geeignet ist.

CVE-2023-47272.description: Roundcube 1.5.x before 1.5.6 and 1.6.x before 1.6.5 allows XSS via a Content-Type or Content-Disposition header (used for attachment preview or download).
